content:
Former village headman of Lisle; age 40; skilled rider with possible military background. Gift-shock from violently awakened Mage-Gift (immensely powerful, type uncertain, possibly Firestarting-adjacent)—mental channels burned open, causing white-hot agony and inability to control magical awareness. Vision blurry, barely functional. Possesses red robe hood/blade as evidence.

IDENTITY: Newly Chosen by Senta; Herald-trainee (official cover). STATE: Physically stable post-Gift manifestation; possesses complete memory-merge with Talia (all state secrets, training, protocol, personal history). GIFT: Mage-Gift—first manifestation leveled Lisle; energy blast capability; untrained but demonstrating unprecedented control. COMMITMENT: Contingency with Senta to be knocked unconscious if loses control. PUBLIC POSITION: Assigned healer's cottage in Companion's Field for safety/discretion; officially 'trainee like any other' to buy time.

White Companion mare, sapphire eyes, silver mane. Adult status 3 years, unpartnered until now. STANCE-Rance: Chose him despite his age/bitterness; bond formed—provides unconditional love, mental stabilization of ragged channels, knowledge of what he is; frustrated by his stubbornness but committed; shares purpose to reach Haven and train his Gift. Recognized red robes indicate organized threat beyond ordinary bandits.

Exhausted from three-day non-stop run to Haven but refused rest to stay with Chosen. Confirmed knowledge: Herald-Mages are historical fact; Karsite blood magic is real history, officially banned for decades. Instructed Rance on Gift-shock treatment (willow bark/valerian/comfrey mixture). Monitored his unconscious state throughout journey—stable but fragile, mind slowly mending. Made contingency agreement: will knock Rance out if he loses control. Avoided main thoroughfares when possible to minimize attention.

STATE: Exhausted from hard travel; coat dulled with road dust and sweat; awaiting promised grooming. STANCE-Rance: Protective; impressed by his pragmatism and leadership; exasperated by his spite-driven impossible feats; proud of contingency planning. ROLE: Enforcing knockout contingency if needed; refusing separation during procedures; monitoring Gift responses; providing steady support through bond. OBSERVATIONS: Recognized Mage-Gift first; warned about Talia's Empathy reach; counseled diplomatic caution with Circle.

PHYSICAL: Fully recovered after thorough grooming and night's rest; coat restored to gleaming silver-white. STANCE-Rance: Comfortable physical intimacy (grooming ritual established). Monitoring for threats; noted Talia's emotional state shift from vulnerable to resolved/controlled overnight.

STATE: Maintained physical distance during coupling but couldn't fully shield from bond—experienced intensity of both participants' emotions despite discomfort. Witnessed Talia's complete transformation and surrender. STANCE-Rance: Concerned about untrained Mage-Gift use (door slam, curtain closure via telekinesis). STANCE-Talia: Surprised by Talia's response to dominance/degradation; recognizes this surrender provides release from constant responsibility.

Small village on Valdemar's outskirts near Karse/Rethwellan/Menmellith borders. Completely obliterated—reduced to ash, charred timber fragments, scorched foundations, crater at epicenter. Destroyed by Rance's uncontrolled Gift release. Population dead or captured. Bandit/cultist footprints lead toward Menmellith.

LOCATION: Remote border village near Karse/Rethwellan/Menmellith crossroads; so isolated Crown assistance effectively nonexistent. ATTACK: Karsites disguised as Menmellith bandits; avoided killing blows to take prisoners alive for blood sacrifice.

Organized group disguised as bandits (red robes hidden under bandit garb). Attacked Lisle to capture villagers; triggered Rance's Gift awakening (unknown if intentional); suffered casualties from magical blast; fled toward Menmellith. Motive unknown. May return.

Queen's Own Companion. Greeted Senta upon arrival at Haven; offered support and reassurance. Recognized urgency of situation.

STANCE-Rance: Positioned beside him throughout Circle meeting without his Chosen present; silent endorsement lending legitimacy; monitoring situation with grave concern tempered by hope; approval carries weight with Circle members.

Historical practice of capturing people for ritual sacrifice, demon summoning. 'Fires of Vkandis Sunlord' consumed many 'impure' souls over centuries. Officially banned in Karse for decades—if now returning, significant threat. Red-robed attackers at Lisle suggest organized magic-users, possibly Karsite operatives disguised as bandits while implicating Menmellith.

Herald-basics flow naturally through bond—tactical knowledge, organizational awareness transfers automatically. Bond strengthens with time/distance; thoughts and emotions become mutually clearer. 'Two beings becoming something greater than the sum of their parts.'

STATE: Profoundly overwhelmed but recovering post-mind-merge; under Healer Crescent's care. MERGE AFTERMATH: Experienced Rance's Lisle memories directly; he worked through her buried trauma (arranged marriage escape, Empathy awakening, isolation, fear of losing identity, crushing responsibility as Queen's Own); first time allowing true vulnerability; walls between compartmentalized self dissolving. STANCE-Rance: Complete mutual knowledge from merge; he knows her deepest fears/secrets including wine preferences; intimacy of shared consciousness (kiss broke connection); conflicted emotions—violation yet gratitude, fear yet fascination; he promised to share burdens she carried alone. CAPABILITY: Full recovery expected; currently unable to perform Queen's Own duties.

INTERNAL SHIFT: Overnight reached definitive decision about handling memory-sharing situation; emotional state transformed from vulnerable/uncertain to controlled/determined/resolved. Experiencing disorientation from fragmented access to Rance's memories (waking reaching for memories that aren't fully there; stride-length mismatch). STANCE-Rance: Seeks his counsel before presenting decision to Selenay; treats as collaborative rather than subordinate despite rank difference. Decision 'potentially changes everything about how we proceed' and 'concerns both of us.'

IDENTITY: Lost virginity to Rance—physical evidence (bite mark on breast, soreness, his seed inside her) will be hidden beneath Whites when meeting Selenay. STATE: Discovered she's aroused by degradation/submission—specifically being called 'Holderkin bitch/slut,' treated as vessel/property; conflicts with Queen's Own dignity but provides profound release from responsibility. Holderkin upbringing vocabulary enables her degradation fantasies. Two intense orgasms; first time experiencing this loss of control. Post-coital clarity returning but fundamentally changed. Ready to present co-advisor arrangement to Selenay while concealing intimate dimension.

STANCE-Rance: Confirmed his mind-merge claim via wine preference detail (only Talia knew); acknowledges extraordinary burden carried; grateful for warning; calculating political ramifications of situation. CONCERNS: Security vulnerability of two people holding Queen's Own knowledge; Mage-Gift return after centuries; Talia's recovery timeline; no training protocols exist. ORDERS: Assigned Rance to healer's cottage; diplomatic inquiries to Karse's neighbors; information sealed to Circle only.

ASSESSMENT: Diagnosed Rance with Gift-shock of extraordinary magnitude, channels forced open, extensive mental pathway trauma; mind-merge should have killed both participants or driven them insane—physically stable outcome 'unfathomable'; cleared both for Circle meeting under observation mandate.

STANCE-Rance: Tested via Vkandis greeting—passed by not taking offense (extremists would have); earned professional respect for caution. ASSESSMENT: Karsite evidence is special forces, officer-grade steel, recent manufacture (within 2 years), suggests state-sanctioned action not rogues. CONCERNS: Practical matters of Mage-Gift training/containment; security implications of two holding Queen's Own knowledge.

First manifestation in Valdemar since Vanyel's era; thought extinct for generations; no living teachers remain; archives may contain sealed Vanyel-era records. Rance's manifestation: energy blast leveling village; unprecedented untrained control (stabilized mind-merge, active shielding); coincides suspiciously with Karsite blood magic return. Title: Herald-Mage. Implications reshape Valdemar's power structure and magical capabilities.

Sun-Priests conducting raids disguised as Menmellith bandits; taking live captives (including young/elderly) across borders for sacrifice/blood magic rituals; possibly demon summoning. Military-grade weapons (officer issue, special forces, <2yr old) indicate state sanction not rogue elements. Represents fundamental policy shift—blood sacrifice officially condemned for generations. Pattern: cyclical extremism returns during Karsite internal instability. Unknown if Valdemar uniquely targeted or broader campaign.

Displayed untrained telekinesis—slammed door and closed curtains with more force than intended; channels described as 'burned open' and 'raw around edges,' causing pain when used; dangerous when uncontrolled (Talia noted could level building). Requires formal training to prevent accidents.
